segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and it’s just getting worse by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn’t even seem to notice, which is unbelievable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the drain must be clogged, but she’s not doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy sneaking cookies to care about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long this has been going on before someone finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is going to be ruined if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is acting right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a slow-motion disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope someone turns off the water soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
